title: Millet Tortillas
directions: Grind flax and chia seeds in a spice or coffee grinder and transfer to a medium sized bowl. Add ¼ cup of water and whisk to combine. Let sit for about 5 minutes to thicken.
Combine millet flour, tapioca starch, salt and herbs (if using) in a medium sized mixing bowl and whisk well to combine.
Add lemon juice, maple syrup and remaining 1½ cups of water to seed mixture and whisk well to combine**
Pour wet ingredients into flour mixture and whisk well to combine.

Place a medium sized saucepan over medium heat and let it heat up. Melt a dab of coconut oil on saucepan and swirl around to coat. Pour ¼ cup of batter onto saucepan and quickly rotate pan to distribute evenly in the pan. Cook approximately 1-1½ minutes per side and repeat until all batter is finished, whisking batter and adding a dab of oil in between each tortilla.
Enjoy the same day for best results. If left until the next day, they will become hard.
ingredients: 1 cup millet flour (freshly ground or pre-ground)*
½ teaspoon dried herbs, such as oregano (optional)
